column4: i have a problem with acerhdf. after installation, as i attempt "modprobe acerhdf", i get "fatal: error inserting acerhdf". does anyone here know why such a problem would occur?
you are not root
have attempted "sudo modprobe", as well as "sudo su", then modprobe - no luck!
i still get "FATAL: Error inserting acerhdf (/lib/modules/2.6.35-28-generic/updates/acerhdf.ko): Invalid argument"
maybe modprobe has a verbose flag
will check!
with verbose flag [sudo modprobe acerhdf -v]: "insmod /lib/modules/2.6.35-28-generic/updates/acerhdf.ko
whats your command for loading the module?
i'm not sure. isn't it just: "insmod /lib/modules/2.6.35-28-generic/updates/acerhdf.ko"
have tried that already, unfortunatly!
hmm, well its not being descriptive about why it fails, maybe there is something in dmesg?
are you sure it should be loadable to begin with

acicula: thanks for the percistancy! i suck at all this advanced stuff, but i simply have followed these instructions: "http://crunchbanglinux.org/wiki/howto/aspireone", regarding the section 'fan control'. will check dmesg now!
oh, and that link says it's loadable, yes!
did you custom build the kernel module or?
no, not at all! not on purpose, at least. eventhough i have modified the system some - due to a lot of bugs with ubuntu on acer aspire one! but anyways:
[    0.000000] ACPI: SLIC 7f6bbe8a 00176 (v01 ACRSYS ACRPRDCT 06040000 acer 00000000)
it seems that is the cause for your error
so your specific model is not, yet at least, supported by that driver
it does, yes! thanks for all the help!
and have a nice evening or day! bye!
